intro: Hypericum orbiculare, commonly known as the golden-stemmed St. John's wort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and rounded, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hypericum orbiculare is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value in gardens.
